snippet.description:
Dads can be role models, teachers, and best friends. But how well can they explain science? For Father’s Day, we called the dads of five Museum scientists, asked them a few questions about their daughter or son’s research, and then played the calls back for our researchers. These are a few of our favorite dad moments.

Follow @AMNH on Twitter to watch all the PhDad conversations on Father's Day, Sunday, June 15, 2018. 

#dads #family #fathersday #science

snippet.description:
Kelly Speer is a Ph.D.-degree candidate in the Richard Gilder Graduate School studying host-parasite interactions in bats. For Father’s Day, we asked her dad Greg a few questions about his daughter’s research. Then we played the call back for Kelly.

Follow @AMNH on Twitter to watch all the PhDad conversations on Father's Day, Sunday, June 17, 2018.

snippet.description:
Adolfo Lara is a Ph.D.-degree candidate in the Richard Gilder Graduate School studying sea anemones and the origins of neural networks. For Father’s Day, we asked his dad Mónico a few questions about his son’s research. Then we played the call back for Adolfo.

Follow @AMNH on Twitter to watch all the PhDad conversations on Father's Day, Sunday, June 17, 2018.
